$the Cardinals argued that a previous pitch had hit Bake McBride, who left the game and had four stitches placed into his right index finger

ej,marsj101,M,craws901,Demanding Ted Simmons' ejection $when Bill Madlock stepped out of the batter's box to protest Al Hrabosky's habit of turning his back to HP before pitching, HP umpire Shag Crawford ordered Hrabosky to pitch and called it a strike; Madlock stepped back in but brushed catcher Ted Simmons with his bat; Jose Cardenal ran to HP from the on deck circle and Cubs manager Jim Marshall also ran out to argue with Crawford; when Simmons hit Madlock, both benches cleared and a 2-minute brawl ensued; Marshall ejected by Crawford arguing that Simmons should be ejected

ej,marsj101,M,craws901,Demanding opponent's ejection $Cubs manager Marshall ejected by HP umpire Crawfor for arguing that catcher Simmons should be ejected for hitting Madlock who had brushed Simmons with his bat during argument about automatic strike called by Crawford when he stepped out of box to protest pitcher Hrabosky's routine of turning his back to the plate during his delivery
